meanings.definition: To commit burglary by breaking into a building with the intent to steal.
meanings.sent1: Last night, the thief was caught burgling a house down the street.
meanings.sent2: Burgling is a serious crime that can lead to imprisonment.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy burgling attempt ended with the thief getting stuck in the window.
meanings.sent4: The idea of someone burgling our home sends shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The news report described the burgling incident in vivid detail.

meanings.definition: The act of burgling or committing burglary.
meanings.sent1: The police were investigating a series of burglaries in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Burgling often leaves behind a trail of destruction and fear.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed a comical version of burgling that had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cybersecurity, hackers are the digital equivalent of burglars burgling data.
meanings.sent5: The museum had high-tech security to prevent any burgling attempts.
